title: Ticket #632: Clone() in DaemonCore::Create_Process() has uninitialized bytes
description:
When running a DAG with a PRE script under valgrind, I get the following error: 

  ==4690== Syscall param clone(parent_tidptr) contains uninitialised byte(s)
  ==4690==    at 0xB7E418: clone (in /lib/libc-2.5.so)
  ==4690==    by 0x814DDA0: DaemonCore::Create_Process(char const*, ArgList  const&, priv_state, int, int, Env const*, char const*, FamilyInfo*, Stream**, int*, int*, int, __sigset_t*, int, unsigned*, int*) (daemon_core.cpp:7525)
  ==4690==    by 0x8131F35: Script::BackgroundRun(int) (script.cpp:106)
  ==4690==    by 0x8132404: ScriptQ::Run(Script*) (scriptQ.cpp:68)
  ==4690==    by 0x811D1B7: Dag::StartNode(Job*, bool) (dag.cpp:1315)
  ==4690==    by 0x8123C0C: Dag::Bootstrap(bool) (dag.cpp:337)
  ==4690==    by 0x8119261: main_init(int, char**) (dagman_main.cpp:880)
  ==4690==    by 0x816063C: main (daemon_core_main.cpp:2108)

This seems to be happening when DAGMan tries to run the PRE script.

Hmm -- this also seems to produce a subsequent error inside dprintf(): 

  ==4959== Jump to the invalid address stated on the next line
  ==4959==    at 0x40B4676: ???
  ==4959==  Address 0x40B4676 is 54 bytes inside a block of size 352 free'd
  ==4959==    at 0x4004FDA: free (vg_replace_malloc.c:233)
  ==4959==    by 0xB04C55: fclose@@GLIBC_2.1 (in /lib/libc-2.5.so)
  ==4959==    by 0x816B75D: fclose_wrapper (dprintf.c:1019)
  ==4959==    by 0x816AD2D: debug_unlock (dprintf.c:611)
  ==4959==    by 0x816A5E9: _condor_dprintf_va (dprintf.c:362)
  ==4959==    by 0x81319B6: debug_printf (debug.cpp:63)
  ==4959==    by 0x8117FC5: Dagman::Config() (dagman_main.cpp:309)
  ==4959==    by 0x81181BD: main_init(int, char**) (dagman_main.cpp:464)
  ==4959==    by 0x8160D98: main (daemon_core_main.cpp:2108)

I don't get that error if there are no PRE/POST scripts.
remarks:
2009-Sep-25 10:43:29 by tannenba:
Valgrind and clone do not mix, this is a known issue.

When valgrinding, configure Condor to use fork() instead of clone.
